metadata.dc:author: Salva Lacombe, J A
López Gibert, J
Caralt Mestres, E
metadata.dc:description: The constant pressure exerted by occlusive ligation on the intestinal wall produces ischemia and ulceration of the mucosa, interruption of the muscular layer and transmural inflammatory reaction, which terminates when the ligature is eliminated and the injured tissues are repaired.
metadata.dc:title: Cambios histopatológicos observados durante la repermeabilización de la luz intestinal después de obliterar el tránsito digestivo con material irreabsorbible. Estudio experimental en la rata.
[Histopathologic changes seen during the reopening of the intestinal lumen after obliteration of the digestive tract with nonabsorbable material. Experimental study in the rat].
metadata.dc:publisher: Revista espanola de las enfermedades del aparato digestivo
